definition: to have no alternative but to/to be obliged to
only/merely/just/but
grain that has begun to ripen/variant of 衹|只[zhi3]
variant of 只[zhi3]
variant of 只[zhi3]
classifier for birds and certain animals, one of a pair, some utensils, vessels etc
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: He had such bad flu that they had to take him to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 他得了严得的流感，只得被子送进医院了。

sentences.english: If yod don't have the right tool for the job, we'll have to make do without it.
sentences.chinese: 假如你没有干这活的适当工具，咱们只得对付着干。

sentences.english: We had to eat some potatoes substituted as a meal.
sentences.chinese: 我们只得吃了几个马铃薯充饥。

sentences.english: We had to push the car home as it broke down half way and we couldst know how to repair it.
sentences.chinese: 半路上车抛锚了，我们又无从修理，只得将其推回。

sentences.english: Eventualy we have to adjust to the environment where fruits are always with worms.
sentences.chinese: 最终我们只得适应水果总会有虫子的环境。

sentences.english: Golgi to school, only to pick up trash money.
sentences.chinese: 高尔基为了上学，只得去捡垃圾换钱。

sentences.english: They had to change the date fixed to Feb. 28th.
sentences.chinese: 他们只得把约期改到2月28日。

sentences.english: So Portia had to show the three boxes to him.
sentences.chinese: 因此波西亚只得把那三只盒子拿给他看。

sentences.english: Tassels on the horns of a dilemma, back to the husbands family and no steps, had to find treasure complex complaint.
sentences.chinese: 流苏进退两难，回婆家又没台阶，只得找宝络诉苦。

sentences.english: I told him that because of the last condition, I'd have to turn it down.
sentences.chinese: 我告诉他，由于那最后一个条件，我只得谢尽。

sentences.english: You will just have to grovel to the bank manager for a loan .
sentences.chinese: 你只得低声下气地向银行经理借贷。

sentences.english: The doctor had to abort the pregnancy.
I take a deep inhale, depressed at the freshness.
sentences.chinese: 但我还得深吸一口清风，只得暂存清新的爱语。

sentences.english: I was surprised; I looked down, flushing, of course.
sentences.chinese: 我很惊讶，只得低下了头，理所当然地脸红了。

sentences.english: When the crash came, the family was forced to dispose of most of its possessions.
sentences.chinese: 家庭破落时，这家人只得变卖大部分家产。

sentences.english: The teacher spoke in a very stern voice and Timothy had to follow her to her room.
sentences.chinese: 老师说得很严厉，蒂莫西只得跟她进房间。

definition: without any better option/to have to/to be forced to
to drop (subject etc)
to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
have no way out/have no alternative/abbr. to 無奈|无奈[wu2 nai4]
you might as well (do it)/simply/just
to brace oneself to do sth/to put a bold face on it/to summon up courage/to force oneself to
can only/obliged to do sth/to have no other choice
to have no way out/to have no alternative
to be compelled/to be forced
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
have no choice or option but to/cannot but/have to/can't help it/can't avoid
straightforward/clear-cut/blunt (e.g. statement)/you might as well/simply
to do with difficulty/to force sb to do sth/reluctant/barely enough
to do something to sb/to deal with/to cope/how?/to no avail
to settle for second best/the next best thing
